alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 6:40PM EDT until September 05 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelbyville, Simpsonville, Pleasureville, Mulberry, Veachland, Cropper, Old Christianburg, Middletown Heights, Chestnut Grove and Elmburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
